[[Malena Ernman]] | relatives = [[Olof Thunberg]] (grandfather) }} '''Greta Ernman Thunberg''' ({{IPA-sv|²ɡreːta ²tʉːnbærj|lang|Greta Thunberg.ogg}}; born 3 January 2003) is a Swedish [[climate activist]] and a role model for international student climate activism.{{cite web |url=https://www.insidescandinavianbusiness.com/article.php?id=371 |title=Greta Thunberg Wins German Award |author-last=Lindgren |author-first=Emma |date=2 April 2019 |website=Inside Scandinavian Business |access-date=9 April 2019}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/21/learning/learning-with-becoming-greta-invisible-girl-to-global-climate-activist-with-bumps-along-the-way.html|title=Learning With: ‘Becoming Greta: “Invisible Girl” to Global Climate Activist, With Bumps Along the Way’|last=Proulx|first=Natalie|date=2019-02-21|work=The New York Times|access-date=2019-05-01|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} She is known for having initiated the [[school strike for climate]] movement that formed in November 2018 and surged globally after the [[2018 United Nations Climate Change Conference|United Nations Climate Change Conference]] (COP24) in December the same year. Her personal activism began in August 2018, when her recurring and solitary ''Skolstrejk för klimatet'' ("School strike for the climate") protesting outside the [[Swedish parliament]] in Stockholm began attracting media coverage.{{cite web |url=https://medium.com/wedonthavetime/this-15-year-old-girl-breaks-swedish-law-for-the-climate-d1a48ab97e3a |title=This 15-year-old Girl Breaks Swedish Law for the Climate |author-last=Olsson |author-first=David |date=23 August 2018 |website=Medium |access-date=26 March 2019}} On 15 March 2019, an estimated 1.4 million students in 112 countries around the world joined her call in the striking and protesting.{{cite web |url=http://harvardpolitics.com/united-states/youth-demand-climate-action-in-global-school-strike/ |title=Youth Demand Climate Action in Global School Strike |author-last1=Cohen |author-first1=Ilana |author-last2=Heberle |author-first2=Jacob |date=19 March 2019 |website=Harvard Political Review |access-date=22 March 2019}} Another event is scheduled for 24 May 2019.{{cite news |url=https://peoplesdispatch.org/2019/03/16/over-1-million-students-across-the-world-join-global-climate-strike/ |title=Over 1 million students across the world join Global Climate Strike |author-last=Shabeer |author-first=Muhammed |date=16 March 2019 |newspaper=Peoples Dispatch |access-date=22 March 2019}} Thunberg has received various prizes and awards for her activism. In March 2019, three members of the [[Storting|Norwegian parliament]] nominated Thunberg for the [[Nobel Peace Prize]].{{cite news |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/climate-activist-greta-thunberg-nobel-peace-prize_n_5c8a4ab8e4b0fbd7662145a4|title=16-Year-Old Climate Activist Greta Thunberg Nominated For Nobel Peace Prize |author-last=Vaglanos |author-first=Alanna |date=14 March 2019 |newspaper=[[Huffington Post]] |access-date=22 March 2019}} == Life == Greta Thunberg was born on 3 January 2003.{{cite news |author-last=Lobbe |author-first=Anne-Marie |title=À 15 ans, elle remet les dirigeants mondiaux à leur place! |url=http://www.sympatico.ca/actualites/decouvertes/a-15-ans-elle-remet-les-dirigeants-mondiaux-a-leur-place-1.8622552 |access-date=3 January 2019 |publisher=Sympatico |date=13 December 2018 |language=fr}} Her mother is Swedish opera singer [[Malena Ernman]] and her father is actor [[Svante Thunberg]],{{cite web |url=https://www.democracynow.org/2018/12/11/meet_the_15_year_old_swedish |title=School Strike for Climate: Meet 15-Year-Old Activist Greta Thunberg, Who Inspired a Global Movement |website=Democracy Now!}} who is named after his distant relative [[Svante Arrhenius]].{{Cite news |author-first=Damian |author-last=Carrington |url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/dec/04/leaders-like-children-school-strike-founder-greta-thunberg-tells-un-climate-summit |title='Our leaders are like children', school strike founder tells climate summit |date=4 December 2018 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]]}} Her grandfather is actor and director [[Olof Thunberg]].{{Cite web |url=https://heavy.com/news/2018/12/greta-thunberg/ |title=Greta Thunberg: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know |author-last=Santiago |author-first=Ellyn |date=14 December 2018 |website=Heavy.com |access-date=5 February 2019}} At a [[TED (conference)#TEDx|TEDx]] talk in November 2018, Thunberg said she first heard about climate change at the age of eight, but could not understand why so little was being done about it.{{cite AV media |author-first=Greta |author-last=Thunberg |date=12 December 2018 |title=School strike for climate – save the world by changing the rules |work=TEDxStockholm |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EAmmUIEsN9A |access-date=29 January 2019 |time=1:46 |location=Stockholm |publisher=TED |quote=I was diagnosed with Asperger's syndrom, OCD, and selective mutism. That basically means I only speak when I think it's necessary. Now is one of those moments… I think that in many ways, we autistic are the normal ones, and the rest of the people are pretty strange, especially when it comes to the sustainability crisis, where everyone keeps saying that climate change is an existential threat and the most important issue of all and yet they just carry on like before.}} At age 11, she became depressed and stopped talking. Later on she was diagnosed with [[Asperger syndrome]], [[obsessive–compulsive disorder]] (OCD), and [[selective mutism]]. She added that selective mutism meant she was speaking only when she needed to and that "now is one of those moments"; and that being on the "spectrum" was an advantage "as almost everything is black or white". Thunberg has said: "I feel like I am dying inside if I don't protest". Her father doesn't like her cutting class but says: "[We] respect that she wants to make a stand. She can either sit at home and be really unhappy, or protest, [skip school] and be happy".{{cite news |title=The Swedish 15-year-old who's cutting class to fight the climate crisis |work=[[The Guardian]] | url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2018/sep/01/swedish-15-year-old-cutting-class-to-fight-the-climate-crisis |date=1 September 2018 |access-date=29 April 2019 }} To lower her family's [[carbon footprint]], she insisted they become [[Veganism|vegan]] and [[give up flying]],{{Cite web |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/world/europe/climate-crusading-schoolgirl-greta-thunberg-pleads-next-generations-case |title=Climate crusading schoolgirl Greta Thunberg pleads next generation's case |date=5 December 2018 |website=[[The Straits Times]] |access-date=22 December 2018}} as she did herself.{{Cite web |url=https://www.repubblica.it/dossier/ambiente/proteste-clima/2019/03/11/news/greta_thunberg_la_paladina_del_clima_mamma_non_vuole_ma_salvero_il_pianeta_-221266090/ |title=Greta Thunberg, la paladina del clima: "Mamma non vuole ma salverò il pianeta" |date=11 March 2019 |website=[[Repubblica.it]] |language=it |access-date=19 April 2019 |quote=Ho smesso di usare l'aereo, ho smesso di mangiare carne e latticini}} == School strike for climate == {{Main|School strike for climate}} [[File:Greta Thunberg 4.jpg|thumb|Greta Thunberg in front of the Swedish parliament in Stockholm, August 2018]] [[File:Old town Stockholm the bike of Greta.jpeg|thumb|Greta Thunberg's bicycle in [[Stockholm]] on 11 September 2018: "The [[global warming|climate crisis]] must be treated as a crisis! The climate is the most important election issue!"]] [[File:Follow Greta! Strike for climate, placard, 2018 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Sign in [[Berlin]], 14 December 2018]] [[file:FridaysForFuture Hamburg 2019-03-01 47 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Thunberg with German climate activist {{ill|Luisa Neubauer|de}} at a strike in Hamburg, 1 March 2019]] On 20 August 2018, Thunberg, who had just started ninth grade, decided to not attend school until the [[Swedish general election, 2018|2018 Sweden general election]] on 9 September after [[2018 European heat wave|heat waves]] and [[2018 Sweden wildfires|wildfires]] in Sweden.{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2018/sep/01/swedish-15-year-old-cutting-class-to-fight-the-climate-crisis |title=The Swedish 15-year-old who's cutting class to fight the climate crisis |date=1 September 2018 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]]}} Her demands were that the Swedish government reduce carbon emissions in accordance with the [[Paris Agreement]], and she protested by sitting outside the [[Riksdag]] every day during school hours with the sign ''Skolstrejk för klimatet'' (school strike for the climate).{{Cite news |url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/our-columnists/the-fifteen-year-old-climate-activist-who-is-demanding-a-new-kind-of-politics |title=The Fifteen-Year-Old Climate Activist Who Is Demanding a New Kind of Politics |date=2 October 2018 |newspaper=[[The New Yorker]]}} After the general elections, she continued to strike only on Fridays, gaining worldwide attention. She inspired school students across the globe to take part in student strikes. As of December 2018, more than 20,000 students had held strikes in at least 270 cities. Thunberg credits the teen activists at [[Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School]] in [[Parkland, Florida]], who organized the [[March For Our Lives]], as the inspiration to begin her school climate strike.{{cite news |title=Teen activist on climate change: If we don't do anything right now, we're screwed |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rGmBkIUwYkA |access-date=10 February 2019 |agency=[[CNN]] |date=23 December 2018}}{{cite news |title=The Guardian view on teenage activists: protesters not puppets – Editorial |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/feb/07/the-guardian-view-on-teenage-activists-look-whos-pulling-the-strings |access-date=11 February 2019 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=7 February 2019}} In her personal [[manifesto]], Thunberg says she is not a climate scientist herself, but merely a messenger who is repeating what scientists have been unsuccessfully communicating to the public for decades. She says students should not have to leave school to protest, and if the public listened to scientists then students could stop protesting and return to school, but that the current political situation does not work this way.{{cite web |url=http://www.commondreams.org/views/2019/02/03/response-lies-and-hate-let-me-make-some-things-clear-about-my-climate-strike |title=In Response to Lies and Hate, Let Me Make Some Things Clear About My Climate Strike |last=Thunberg |first=Greta |date=3 February 2019 |website=Common Dreams |access-date=22 March 2019}} From October 2018 onwards, Thunberg's activism evolved from solitary protesting to taking part in demonstrations throughout Europe; making several high profile public speeches; and mobilising her growing number of followers on [[social media]] platforms. However, by March 2019 she still stages her regular protests outside the Swedish parliament every Friday, where other students now occasionally join her. Her activism has not interfered with her schoolwork, but she has had less spare time.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/11/greta-thunberg-schoolgirl-climate-change-warrior-some-people-can-let-things-go-i-cant |title=Greta Thunberg, schoolgirl climate change warrior: 'Some people can let things go. I can't' |author-last=Watts |author-first=Jonathan |date=11 March 2019 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |access-date=11 March 2019}} [[Secretary-General of the United Nations|UN General Secretary]] [[António Guterres]] has endorsed the school strikes initiated by Thunberg, admitting that "My generation has failed to respond properly to the dramatic challenge of climate change. This is deeply felt by young people. No wonder they are angry."{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/mar/15/climate-strikers-urgency-un-summit-world-leaders |title=The climate strikers should inspire us all to act at the next UN summit |date=15 March 2019 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |access-date=18 March 2019 |author-link=António Guterres |author-first=António |author-last=Guterres}} == Subsequent speeches == [[File:Greta Thunberg at the Parliament (33744056408) (cropped).jpg|thumb|Greta Thunberg at the European Parliament in April 2019]] === Public demonstrations === Greta Thunberg participated in the Rise for Climate demonstration outside the [[European Parliament]] in [[Brussels]]. In [[London]] in October 2018, she addressed the 'Declaration of Rebellion' organized by [[Extinction Rebellion]] opposite the [[Houses of Parliament]]. She said: "We're facing an immediate unprecedented crisis that has never been treated as a crisis and our leaders are all acting like children. We need to wake up and change everything".{{Cite news |url=https://www.commondreams.org/news/2018/10/31/our-darkest-hour-declaration-rebellion-new-group-vows-mass-civil-disobedience-save |title=This Is Our Darkest Hour: With Declaration of Rebellion, New Group Vows Mass Civil Disobedience to Save Planet |date=31 October 2018 |work=Common Dreams}}{{cite news |author-last=Rizvi |author-first=Husna |title=For climate action, ‘mass civil disobedience’ is the only way |url=https://newint.org/features/2018/11/01/climate-breakdown |access-date=15 February 2019 |work=New Internationalist |date=1 November 2018}} === TEDxStockholm === On 24 November 2018, she spoke at TEDxStockholm.{{cite web |title=TEDxStockholm Theme: Wonderland |url=https://www.ted.com/tedx/events/31825 |publisher=TED |access-date=20 December 2018}}{{cite web |author-first=Jon |author-last=Queally |title=Depressed and Then Diagnosed With Autism, Greta Thunberg Explains Why Hope Cannot Save Planet But Bold Climate Action Still Can |url=https://www.commondreams.org/news/2018/12/19/depressed-and-then-diagnosed-autism-greta-thunberg-explains-why-hope-cannot-save |publisher=Common Dreams |access-date=20 December 2018 |date=19 December 2018}} She spoke about realizing, when she was eight years old, that [[global warming|climate change]] existed and wondering why it was not headline news on every channel, as if there was a world war going on. She said she did not go to school to become a climate scientist, as some suggested, because the science was done and only denial, ignorance and inaction remained. Speculating that her children and grandchildren would ask her why they had not taken action in 2018 when there was still time, she concluded with "we can’t change the world by playing by the rules, because the rules have to be changed."{{cite news |author-last=Jones |author-first=Nigel |title=Why we all need to be more like Greta |url=https://medium.com/nine-by-five-media/why-we-all-need-to-be-more-like-greta-ba36abec961 |access-date=15 February 2019 |work=Nine by Five Media |publisher=Medium |date=30 December 2018}} === COP24 summit === Thunberg addressed the [[COP24]] United Nations climate change summit on 4 December 2018 and also spoke before the plenary assembly on 12 December 2018.{{cite web |author-last=Thunberg |author-first=Greta |author-link=Greta Thunberg |title=You Are Stealing Our Future: Greta Thunberg, 15, Condemns the World's Inaction on Climate Change |url=https://www.democracynow.org/2018/12/13/you_are_stealing_our_future_greta |website=Democracy Now! |access-date=13 December 2018 |quote=You only speak of a green eternal economic growth because you are too scared of being unpopular. You only talk about moving forward with the same bad ideas that got us into this mess, even when the only sensible thing to do is pull the emergency brake. You are not mature enough to tell it like it is. Even that burden you leave to us children. […] And if solutions within the system are so impossible to find, then maybe we should change the system itself.}}{{cite web |title=Greta Thunberg full speech at UN Climate Change COP24 Conference |author-first=Greta |author-last=Thunberg |author-link=Greta Thunberg |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VFkQSGyeCWg |date=12 December 2019}} During the summit, she also participated in a panel talk together with representatives of the We Don't Have Time Foundation, in which she talked about how the school strike began.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqlTtZ0UyFE&t=6s === Davos === On 23 January 2019, Thunberg arrived in [[Davos]] after a 32-hour train journey,{{cite news |author-last=Larson |author-first=Nina |title=Time to 'get angry', teen climate activist says in Davos |url=https://news.yahoo.com/time-angry-teen-climate-activist-says-davos-015904861.html |access-date=24 January 2019 |work=news.yahoo.com |agency=AFP |date=24 January 2019 |quote=I think it is insane that people are gathered here to talk about the climate and they arrive here in private jet.}} in contrast to the many delegates who arrived by up to {{val|1500}} individual private jet flights,{{cite news |author-last=Forrest |author-first=Adam |title=Record number of private jets to fly into Davos conference addressing climate change |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/environment/davos-2019-private-jets-climate-change-world-economic-forum-summit-attenborough-a8742681.html |access-date=24 January 2019 |work=[[The Independent]] |date=23 January 2019}} to continue her climate campaign at the [[World Economic Forum]].{{cite news |author-last1=Kottasova |author-first1=Ivana |author-last2=Mackintosh |author-first2=Eliza |title=Teen activist blames Davos elite for climate crisis |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2019/01/25/europe/greta-thunberg-davos-world-economic-forum-intl/index.html |access-date=26 January 2019 |newspaper=[[CNN]] |date=25 January 2019}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-europe-47231271/greta-thunberg-the-swedish-teen-inspiring-climate-strikes |title=Greta Thunberg: The Swedish teen inspiring climate strikes |publisher=[[BBC News]] |type=video, 2 min 4 sec |date=14 February 2019}} She told a Davos panel "Some people, some companies, some decision makers in particular have known exactly what priceless values they have been sacrificing to continue making unimaginable amounts of money. I think many of you here today belong to that group of people."{{cite news |author-last=Hertsgaard |author-first=Mark |title=The Climate Kids Are Coming |url=https://www.thenation.com/article/greta-thunberg-climate-change-davos/ |access-date=14 February 2019 |agency=The Nation |date=28 January 2019}} Later in the week, she warned the global leaders that "I don't want you to be hopeful. I want you to panic. I want you to feel the fear I feel every day. And then I want you to act. I want you to act as you would in a crisis. I want you to act as if the house was on fire – because it is". I want you to panic: 16-year-old issues climate warning at Davos – [https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=160&v=RjsLm5PCdVQ Greta on Youtube]. She wrote in an article for ''[[The Guardian]]'' in January 2019: "According to the IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change), we are less than 12 years away from not being able to undo our mistakes. In that time, unprecedented changes in all aspects of society need to have taken place, including a reduction of our [[carbon dioxide|{{CO2}}]] emissions by at least 50%". {{cite news |last=Thunberg|first=Greta|title='Our house is on fire': Greta Thunberg, 16, urges leaders to act on climate|url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/jan/25/our-house-is-on-fire-greta-thunberg16-urges-leaders-to-act-on-climate |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=25 January 2019|access-date=14 February 2019 }} === European Economic & Social Committee === On 21 February 2019, she spoke at a conference of the [[European Economic and Social Committee]] and to [[European Commission]] chief [[Jean-Claude Juncker]], where she said that to limit global warming to less than the two degrees C goal established at the [[Paris climate accord]], the [[EU]] must reduce their [[carbon dioxide|{{CO2}}]] emissions by 80% by 2030, double the 40% goal set in Paris. "If we fail to do so" she said, "all that will remain of our political leaders' legacy will be the greatest failure of human history." Later, she joined 7,500 Belgian student in a climate protest in [[Brussels]].{{cite news |author-last=Carmichael |author-first=Lachlan |title=Climate activist Thunberg urges EU to double carbon reduction targets |url=https://news.yahoo.com/climate-activist-thunberg-urges-eu-double-carbon-reduction-111042030.html |access-date=22 February 2019 |work=news.yahoo.com |date=21 February 2019}}{{cite news |title=Swedish teen leads Belgian students on 7th climate march |work=[[Miami Herald]]|agency=[[The Associated Press]] |date=21 February 2019 |url=https://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/article226559019.html |access-date=22 February 2019 |dead-url=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190222204457/https://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/article226559019.html |archive-date=22 February 2019}} === Berlin === In the weekend 29-31 March, Thunberg visited Berlin. She spoke in front of some 25,000 people near the [[Brandenburg Gate]] on Friday, where she argued that "We live in a strange world where children must sacrifice their own education in order to protest against the destruction of their future. Where the people who have contributed the least to this crisis are the ones who are going to be affected the most."{{cite web |url=http://www.pressenza.com/2019/03/fridays-for-future-25000-demonstrate-in-berlin-with-greta-thunberg/ |title=Fridays for the Future: 25,000 demonstrate in Berlin with Greta Thunberg |author-last=Thumiger |author-first=Reto |date=31 March 2019 |website=Pressenza |access-date=5 April 2019 }} After the speech, Thunberg and fellow climate activist {{ill|Luisa Neubauer|de}} visited the [[Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research]] and met with scientists there. On Saturday, Thunberg received the [[Goldene Kamera|'Golden Camera']] Special Award on Germany's annual film and television award show. In her acceptance speech at the gala, Thunberg urged celebrities everywhere to use their influence and do their fair share of climate activism to help her.{{cite web |url= https://www.cleanenergywire.org/news/greta-thunberg-joins-german-students-climate-protest-berlin |title=Greta Thunberg joins German students for climate protest in Berlin |author-last1=Waldholz |author-first1=Rachel |author-last2=Wehrmann |author-first2=Benjamin |date=29 March 2019 |website=Clean Energy Wire |access-date=5 April 2019}}{{cite web |url=https://www.plantbasednews.org/post/greta-thunberg-celebrities-face-climate-crisis |title=Greta Thunberg Calls Out Celebrities To Face Climate Crisis In Powerful Speech |author-last=Gilliver |author-first=Liam |date=4 April 2019 |website=Plant Based News |access-date=12 April 2019}} === EU leaders === At an April 2019 meeting at the [[European Parliament]] in Strasbourg with MEP's and EU officials, she chided those present "for three emergency Brexit summits and no emergency summit regarding the breakdown of the climate and the environment". Climate change discussions have not been dominant at EU summits because other issues have taken precedence.{{cite news|last=Rankin|first=Jennifer|url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/apr/16/greta-thunberg-urges-eu-leaders-wake-up-climate-change-school-strike-movement|title=Forget Brexit and focus on climate change, Greta Thunberg tells EU|work=The Guardian|date=16 April 2019|access-date=24 April 2019}} She continued: "The extinction rate is up to 10,000 times faster than what is considered normal, with up to 200 species becoming extinct every single day". In addition, the "[e]rosion of fertile topsoil, deforestation of the rainforest, toxic air pollution, loss of insects and wildlife, acidification of our oceans ... are all disastrous trends." Thunberg was given a 30-second standing ovation at the end of her speech. == Prizes and awards == Greta Thunberg was one of the winners of [[Svenska Dagbladet]]'s debate article writing competition on the climate for young people in May 2018.{{Cite web |url=https://www.svd.se/vi-vet--och-vi-kan-gora-nagot-nu |title="Vi vet – och vi kan göra något nu" |website=SvD.se |language=sv |access-date=22 December 2018}} Thunberg was nominated for the electricity company Telge Energi's prize for children and young people who promote sustainable development, ''Children's Climate Prize,'' but declined because the finalists would have to fly to Stockholm.{{Cite web |url=https://www.etc.se/klimat/darfor-nobbar-greta-thunberg-klimatpriset |title=Därför nobbar Greta Thunberg klimatpriset |author-last=Gelin |author-first=Gustav |date=1 November 2018 |website=ETC |language=sv |access-date=22 December 2018}} In November 2018, she was awarded the [[Fryshuset]] scholarship of the Young Role Model of the Year.{{Cite web |url=https://www.aktuellhallbarhet.se/greta-thunberg-blir-arets-unga-forebild/ |title=Greta Thunberg blir Årets unga förebild |date=22 November 2018 |website=Aktuell Hållbarhet |language=sv-SE |access-date=22 December 2018}} In December 2018, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine named Thunberg one of the world's 25 most influential teenagers of 2018.{{Cite web |url=http://time.com/5463721/most-influential-teens-2018/ |title=TIME's 25 Most Influential Teens of 2018 |journal=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |access-date=22 December 2018}} On the occasion of the [[International Women's Day]] Thunberg was proclaimed the [[Swedish Woman of the Year|most important woman of the year in Sweden]] in 2019. The award was based on a survey by the institute ''Inizio'' on behalf of the newspaper ''[[Aftonbladet]]''.{{cite news |title=Schulstreik fürs Klima – Klimaaktivistin Greta Thunberg in Schweden "Frau des Jahres"|language=de |author=dpa |journal=[[Zeit Online]] |date=8 March 2019 |url=https://www.zeit.de/news/2019-03/08/klimaaktivistin-greta-thunberg-in-schweden-frau-des-jahres-190308-99-297313 |access-date=8 March 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190309164608/https://www.zeit.de/news/2019-03/08/klimaaktivistin-greta-thunberg-in-schweden-frau-des-jahres-190308-99-297313 |archive-date=8 March 2019}} On 31 March 2019, she received the German [[Goldene Kamera]] Special Climate Protection award.{{cite web |author=Staff |title=Greta Thunberg wird mit der GOLDENEN KAMERA 2019 ausgezeichnet |trans-title=Greta Thunberg is awarded the GOLDEN CAMERA 2019 |publisher=[[Goldene Kamera]] |date=18 March 2019 |language=de |url=https://www.goldenekamera.de/preisverleihung/nominierte-preistraeger-2019/article216694793/Greta-Thunberg-wird-mit-der-GOLDENEN-KAMERA-2019-ausgezeichnet.html |access-date=31 March 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190331123607/https://www.goldenekamera.de/preisverleihung/nominierte-preistraeger-2019/article216694793/Greta-Thunberg-wird-mit-der-GOLDENEN-KAMERA-2019-ausgezeichnet.html |archive-date=31 March 2019}}{{cite news |title=Verleihung der Goldenen Kamera Erst Klimaaktivistin geehrt, dann SUV verschenkt – Erst bekommt Greta Thunberg die "Goldene Kamera". Dann verschenkt Hauptsponsor Volkswagen einen SUV. Das stößt auf Kritik. |author-first=Claudia |author-last=Seiring |language=de |newspaper=[[Der Tagesspiegel]] |date=31 March 2019 |url=https://www.tagesspiegel.de/gesellschaft/verleihung-der-goldenen-kamera-erst-klimaaktivistin-geehrt-dann-suv-verschenkt/24164272.html |access-date=31 March 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190331224547/https://www.tagesspiegel.de/gesellschaft/verleihung-der-goldenen-kamera-erst-klimaaktivistin-geehrt-dann-suv-verschenkt/24164272.html |archive-date=31 March 2019}} On 2 April 2019, the [[Prix Liberté]] from Normandie, France.{{cite web |title=Greta Thunberg lauréate du Prix Liberté ! |language=fr |publisher=Région Normandie |date=1 April 2019 |url=https://www.normandie.fr/greta-thunberg-laureate-du-prix-liberte/ |access-date=14 April 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190410010253/https://www.normandie.fr/greta-thunberg-laureate-du-prix-liberte |archive-date=10 April 2019}} On 12 April 2019 she shared the [[Fritt Ords Prize]] from Norway with the [[Natur og Ungdom]] organization.{{cite web |title=Fritt Ords Pris 2019 til Natur og Ungdom og Greta Thunberg |language=no |date=12 April 2019 |publisher=[[Fritt Ord (organization)|Fritt Ord]] |editor-first1=Grete |editor-last1=Brochmann |editor-first2=Bård Vegar |editor-last2=Solhjell |url=http://www.frittord.no/aktuelt/fritt-ords-pris-2019-til-natur-og-ungdom-og-greta-thunberg/ |access-date=14 April 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415201234/http://www.frittord.no/aktuelt/fritt-ords-pris-2019-til-natur-og-ungdom-og-greta-thunberg/ |archive-date=15 April 2019}} This prize is awarded for freedom of expression. On 13 March 2019, three members of the [[Storting|Norwegian parliament]] nominated Thunberg as a candidate for the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] later this year. The nominating politicians motivated their decision by arguing that [[global warming]] will be the cause of "wars, conflict and refugees" if nothing is done to halt it. Thunberg responded that she was "honoured and very grateful" for the nomination. If Thunberg receives the Prize later this year, she will become the youngest person ever to receive it.{{cite news |url=https://www.ecowatch.com/greta-thunberg-nobel-peace-prize-2631637803.html?rebelltitem=6#rebelltitem6 |title=Greta Thunberg—Swedish Teen who Inspired School Climate Strikes—Nominated for Nobel Peace Prize |author-last=Rosane |author-first=Olivia |date=14 March 2019 |newspaper=EcoWatch |access-date=22 March 2019}} In April 2019, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine named Greta Thunberg as one of the 100 most influential people of 2019.{{cite journal |author-last=González |author-first=Emma |title=Greta Thunberg |journal=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |url=http://time.com/collection/100-most-influential-people-2019/5567758/greta-thunberg |access-date=18 April 2019}} In the same month, the Chilean-based organization Fundación Milarepa para el Diálogo con Asia, headed by [[Mario Aguilar]] of the [[University of St Andrews]], announced that Thunberg had been selected as the recipient of the organization's [[Laudato Si' Award]].{{cite news |title=Greta Thunberg Winner of the Laudato Si' Prize 2019! |author-first=Fundación |author-last=Milarepa |date=19 April 2019 |newspaper=FundaciónMilarepa |url=https://fundacionmilarepachile.org/2019/04/19/greta-thunberg-winner-of-the-laudato-si-prize-2019/ |access-date=20 April 2019 |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190420170424/https://fundacionmilarepachile.org/2019/04/19/greta-thunberg-winner-of-the-laudato-si-prize-2019/ |archive-date=20 April 2019}} == Controversy == After her student climate strikes gained momentum, attempts were made to discredit her by climate change deniers.{{Cite web|url=https://climatechangedispatch.com/whats-behind-climate-change-activist-greta-thunbergs-remarkable-rise-to-fame/|title=What’s Behind Climate Change Activist Greta Thunberg’s Remarkable Rise To Fame?|date=13 February 2019|website=Climate Change Dispatch|language=en-US|access-date=25 April 2019}}{{cite news |author-last=Sandler Clarke |author-first=Joe |title=The Climate Change Deniers Trying to Discredit Greta Thunberg |url=https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/mbzg8q/the-climate-change-deniers-trying-to-discredit-greta-thunberg |work=Vice |date=7 February 2019}} Others have tried to benefit from her high profile.{{cite news |author-last=Oroschakoff |author-first=Kalina |title=Teen climate icon used for fundraising without her knowledge |url=https://www.politico.eu/article/greta-thunberg-teen-climate-icon-used-for-fundraising-without-her-knowledge/ |work=Politico-EU |date=February 2019}} In late 2018, Ingmar Rentzhog, founder of the non-profit We Don't Have Time Foundation (WDHT), recruited Thunberg to become an unpaid youth advisor and used Thunberg's name and image without her knowledge or permission to raise millions for WDHT's for-profit subsidiary We Don't Have Time AB, of which Rentzhog is CEO. Thunberg received no money from the company.{{cite news |newspaper=[[Svenska Dagbladet]] |url=https://www.svd.se/rentzhog-darfor-ber-vi-greta-thunberg-om-ursakt |title=Swedish start-up used Greta Thunberg to bring in millions}}{{cite web |work=TheLocal.se |url=https://www.thelocal.se/20190209/start-up-used-child-climate-activist-to-raise-millions |title=Start-up used teen climate activist to raise millions: Swedish paper |date=9 February 2019}} She terminated her volunteer advisor role with WDHT, stating she "is not part of any organization… am absolutely independent… [and] do what I do completely for free."{{cite web |author-last=Thunberg |author-first=Greta |author-link=Greta Thunberg |title=Greta Thunberg |url=https://www.facebook.com/732846497083173/posts/767646880269801/ |website=www.facebook.com |access-date=15 February 2019 |date=2 February 2019}} Writing for ''[[Quillette]]'' magazine, Swedish journalist {{ill|Paulina Neuding|sv}} questioned whether the fame and attention that Thunberg has received puts excessive pressure on her. Neuding wondered if this could be a problem considering her multiple mental diagnoses by claiming that "a school strike... constitutes a form of self-harm, undertaken to attract adult attention... Given what we know about Greta’s problems and challenges, is this (attention) an appropriate adult response to Greta’s school strike?"{{cite web |last1=Neuding |first1=Paulina |title=Self-Harm Versus the Greater Good: Greta Thunberg and Child Activism |url=https://quillette.com/2019/04/23/self-harm-versus-the-greater-good-greta-thunberg-and-child-activism/ |website=Quillette |accessdate=25 April 2019 |language=en-AU |date=23 April 2019}} Writing for ''[[The Spectator]]'', [[Helen Dale]], who also writes for Quillete, stated that despite the fact that Thunberg is autistic, her ideas should be open to criticism, and that she is being exploited for political purposes by adults.{{cite news |last1=Dale |first1=Helen |title=Greta Thunberg’s supporters can’t have it both ways |url=https://blogs.spectator.co.uk/2019/04/greta-thunbergs-supporters-cant-have-it-both-ways/ |accessdate=30 April 2019 |work=Spectator |date=29 April 2019}} In response, [[Chris Packham]], the ''[[Springwatch]]'' presenter who also has Asperger's says "People like me with Asperger's syndrome are not affected by this sort of thing. It doesn't weaken our resolve. We've seen it this week with the trolling of Greta. It's a complete waste of time."{{cite news |last1=Barkham |first1=Patrick |title=Chris Packham defiant after activists leave dead crows at his home |url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/apr/25/dead-crows-left-at-chris-packhams-home-in-row-over-killing-pest-birds |accessdate=28 April 2019 |work=The Guardian |date=25 April 2019}} In an article headlined ''Why They're Really Scared Of Greta Thunberg'', ''[[Huffington Post]]'' argues that Thunberg "frighten(s) the life out of a particular middle-aged and middle-class establishment type of person... and that the reaction to her is driven by the fear of knowing that losing their place to her and those like her (in political conversation) is inevitable."{{cite news |last1=Grant |first1=Alan |title=Why They're Really Scared Of Greta Thunberg |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/greta-thunberg_uk_5cc2c77de4b00dceee75a8ca |accessdate=28 April 2019 |work=HuffPost UK |date=26 April 2019 |language=en}} == See also == *[[Severn Cullis-Suzuki]] – as a minor was also a notable environmental activist. *''[[Juliana v.
